speaker: HUNGRY GUY
line: Hello? Hello! Hey! I'm sitting here, dude!

speaker: MALE VOICE
line: Sorry. We're closed.

speaker: HUNGRY GUY
line: Uh-uh. I was here before you turned off the light. Grandfather clause, man. I need a super patty, double with cheese...

speaker: MALE VOICE
line: The light was a mistake. We're closed. Sorry.

speaker: HUNGRY GUY
line: The light was on! How bad do you want this job? 'Cause I'll call the head office right now. Super patty. Double. With cheese. Supersize fries. Supersize Diet Sprite.

speaker: MALE VOICE
line: Drive through, please.

speaker: HUNGRY GUY
line: What the hell is this? Customer service, man. Stop spanking it and get my food.

speaker: HUNGRY GUY
line: Hey, in there. Guy?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: You... are your own man and you control everything you do.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Hey, yo, Derwood.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Hey, Rob.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Hey, Mr. Rice.

speaker: MR. RICE
line: How's it going, Rob?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Have a good one, Lucy.

speaker: LUCY
line: You, too, Rob.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Welcome to Lucky Boy. May I take your order?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, we'll have it our way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: FBI. Special Agents Scully and Mulder. We'd like a word with your manager, please.

speaker: MR. RICE
line: Well, that's me. How can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, would you do us a favor and gather your employees, please?

speaker: LUCY
line: Well, what's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're investigating a murder. A car was found in a reservoir ten miles from here. A body was found in the trunk of that car.

speaker: MR. RICE
line: What does that have to do with us?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, this was also found in the car. It's a badge that's only given to employees. Is that correct?

speaker: MR. RICE
line: Yeah, "free fer" Fridays -- it's our promotion where you buy one superpatty and get one free. But look -- there's four Lucky Boys in Costa Mesa alone and something like 30 in Orange County.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thirty-two.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, long day. So let's make this quick. Does everybody have their button?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: We only wear them on Fridays. For "free fer" Fridays.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but does everybody have their button?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, uh, you... back there, what's your name?

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Derwood Spinks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Derwood. Do you have your button, Derwood?

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Uh, no, I must have left it at home on account of we're supposed to only wear them on Fridays.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Well, I sure as hell didn't leave it on no dead guy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe that we said the victim was male.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're going to ask everybody to step outside right now while we take a quick look around the premises.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Who was the victim?

speaker: MULDER
line: His name was Donald Edward Pankow. Does that ring a bell?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: I'm going to get some cigarettes.

speaker: MR. RICE
line: I guess I'd better call the corporate headquarters and find out what they want us to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, check it out. You know how they say you never want to see the kitchen of any of your favorite restaurants?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Somehow, I don't think Lucky Boy would make that list.

speaker: MULDER
line: My point being that this is a hell of a lot cleaner than all the others. Don't you think?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess. So what are you saying, Mulder? This place has been scrubbed from top to bottom to cover up evidence?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe. Maybe I'm thinking this was the crime scene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying Mr. Pankow had his brain very neatly removed from his skull right here in this kitchen?

speaker: MULDER
line: It had to happen somewhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But next to the shake machine, Mulder? I think that we should be checking out employee lockers and not entertaining the idea that ad hoc surgery was performed here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wouldn't exactly call it surgery. What if this man's brain was eaten?

speaker: MULDER
line: I-it's not sociologically unheard of. There are certain tribes in New Guinea that consider human brains a delicacy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but Mulder, we're in Orange County.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, what's your point?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's just that nothing about the way the body was dumped suggests a fetishistic killing. The brain wasn't removed intact. What if this man's brain was eaten right out of his skull?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Through an inch-and-a-half opening that looks like it was cut with a hole saw?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe it was cut. Maybe it was punched. What look like tool marks to you look to me like something more organic. Like it was made by a... a tongue or a proboscis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The proboscis of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh. Hello. Look at this. Does that look like blood to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, it looks like it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that? Next to it. Is that, uh... oh, my... ugh. Is that brain? Is that brain matter there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'd say that's ground beef.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ground beef.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Rob Roberts? It's Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello, again. Sorry to bother you at home.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No. No bother.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I come in?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah, sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Great, great.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Uh, what... what can I do for you?

speaker: MULDER
line: You live here alone?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah, it's just me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh-huh. Mom or girlfriend?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, man, who cleans up after you?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Neither. It's just me I-I live here alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, bravo. You know, they say single guys are just bears who own furniture, but... I mean, my place... Oh, but here... you can smell the Pine-Sol.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Thanks. Can I, can I get you anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, a cheeseburger and a large order of fries. Heh. It's a bad joke. I'm sorry. Um... Mr. Rice, your manager? He told me that, uh... you stayed late on Friday? Is that right?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Oh, yeah, sure. Friday. The freezer had died on us. I stayed after to throw out the meat that was going bad.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, did you volunteer to close?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, okay. You volunteered.

speaker: MULDER
line: Volunteered... um... the, uh... the 35 pounds of ground chuck that Mr. Rice told you to throw away. What did you do with that?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I threw it out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: In the dumpster behind the restaurant.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm. That's weird. Because that's what I figured you did, so I checked the dumpster and it was empty, which is weird because it only gets cleaned out on Thursday and you would have thrown away the meat on Friday so you'd expect the meat to be there, right?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't see how that's relevant to this murder case anyway. Let me see if there's anything else I wanted to ask you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Blood. You're, you're bleeding.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I-I bit my lip.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm. I think that just about wraps it up for me here.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Oh, hey. I, uh... I hope you catch the guy, huh?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. No, I already got a pretty good idea who it is. Thanks.

speaker: STEVE KIZIAK
line: What do you want?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Uh... Nothing.

speaker: STEVE KIZIAK
line: So take a hike.

speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
line: Uh, hi. This is a message for Rob Roberts. My name is Dr. Mindy Rinehart and I'm a licensed mental health counselor with the Lucky Boy Corporation's employee assistance program. I'm talking to all of the employees at your restaurant about the recent unpleasantness that tomorrow morning. As it is a requirement of your employer's insurance provider this meeting is mandatory. I'm in the Irvine Medical Park, Suite 308. Have a good evening.

speaker: MOTIVATIONAL SPEAKER
line: Self-discipline. Huh. That's the name of this game. That's the one thing that separates us from the animals-- provided you have it. But where do you get it? You can't go down to the local convenience store and buy self-discipline. You can't order it over the Internet. So... where does it come from? True story. I used to weigh 356 pounds.

speaker: MOTIVATIONAL SPEAKER
line: Do you believe that? Well, it's true. I lived to eat, ladies and gentlemen. My entire life revolved around eating because I was always hungry! My appetite was controlling me. Four-star restaurants, Denny's-- it didn't matter. And it didn't stop. It didn't stop till I took charge of my own life. It didn't stop until I put on the brakes and I said, "whoa...

speaker: ROB ROBERTS AND MOTIVATIONAL SPEAKER
line: "...Ricardo, you are your own man and you control everything that you do."

speaker: STEVE KIZIAK
line: Oh, brother. What?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What?!... Derwood... how did you get in here?

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: It's a little skill I picked up in Chino. I did a nickel for attempted murder. You didn't know I was an ex-con? Yeah, nobody at work did. Not until this FBI murder investigation whipped everybody up into a froth.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Derwood, what can I do for you?

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: You know I got fired last night? Stupid little pissant job where they make you wear a paper hat-- and they fired me. Plus, as far as that, uh, redheaded FBI Agent's concerned I'm the prime suspect in this murder. But that's no skin off my nose seeing as you did it.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Diet pills. Yours, right? See, I found them when I opened up on Saturday morning. I didn't give them back 'cause I figured, hey, free speed, right? But then there's this whole flap about a murder and I notice this.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: That ain't ketchup, man.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What-what do you want, Derwood?

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: I don't know. What do you got? TV, VCR... Ah, it's all crappy off-brand stuff but you know, I'll take that and whatever money you got in the bank and you get this and I keep my mouth shut and, just maybe, you can blow town before the long arm of the law reaches out and grabs you by the gonads.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Maybe not. Cup 'em.

speaker: SYLVIA JASSY
line: Hi. Rob? I hate to bother you, but, uh... last night in the front of the building there was a man in a parked car for hours. Did you happen to see him? It was a maroon car. He was pretty clean-cut, so I didn't call the police but he was still there when I went to bed.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Gee, Sylvia, I don't know what to tell you.

speaker: SYLVIA JASSY
line: He's gone now, but just, you know, keep your eyes out in case he comes back.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: You got it.

speaker: SYLVIA JASSY
line: Thanks.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: So, I'll call you tonight and let you know where to drop off my new VCR. Oh, and don't try skipping town. You won't get too far.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, just the man I wanted to see. How are you this morning, Rob?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm glad I caught you. Oh, hey, I was just driving to your apartment and I saw Derwood Spinks not a block from here. He wasn't coming from your place by any chance, was he?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No, no. I haven't seen him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good. I'd stay away from him. He's our prime suspect in the Pankow murder.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: You think he did it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Me? No. No, I should say that's the opinion of the Costa Mesa police. And my partner.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: So he's-he's not your guy.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think we're looking for somebody who has a compulsion meat that you threw in the dumpster.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What about it?

speaker: MULDER
line: The dumpster had a padlock.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who would have the key?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: We do, and the trucking company does.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Hey-hey, wait. What-what's your point?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm just tying up some loose ends.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Good, you got my message, Rob, I appreciate you coming. This will be really informal. There you go. I want to run through some things with you, but we don't stand on ceremony here so if there's anything that you want to talk about just go ahead and blurt it out okay, okay? It hasn't been a run-of-the-mill week so far, has it?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: The police have been at the restaurant and the FBI. I'm sure this has been a very stressful time for you.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Pretty much.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: So we want to keep on top of any potential problems that these stresses might cause for you. So let's run through some standard questions together.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Rob, have you been troubled recently by insomnia? Bad dreams or nightmares?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Have you felt emotionally numb? Do you ever see things that aren't there? Do you hear voices?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Tell me, Rob, do you feel...

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: This... this murder... this murder that happened.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Yes?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What kind of a monster would do something like that?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: I don't believe in monsters. But I do believe in people and sometimes they do terrible things out of weakness or sickness or fear but I do truly believe that deep down inside even the worst of us wants to be good. Rob, is there anything that's troubling you that you'd like to talk about?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: I'm sorry. I though I put that on voice mail. Mindy Rinehart. Yes, Agent Mulder, what can I do for you? No, I'm afraid I can't do that. I'm sorry, but it would violate patient confidentiality.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I, uh...

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Excuse me, Agent. Rob?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah. I have to go to work now.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Would you please call me later so that we could finish our talk?

speaker: MR. RICE
line: You shouldn't be here, Derwood. We would have mailed you your last check.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Just give me my money, Rice.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: How you doing, killer? You better have some money for me, too, huh?

speaker: MR. RICE
line: There. Now, please leave.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: With pleasure, pal. Boy, I ought to just make happy hour. Uh, since this is farewell, when nobody was looking I used to dip my boys in the cole slaw.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Bon appetit.

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: If somebody's still in here, you're in a world of hurt!

speaker: DERWOOD SPINKS
line: Rob... You looking for these? Deal's off, buddy. Remember that guy you iced? Pankow? I just heard he didn't have a brain in his head. You're one sick little freak, man. You got a lot of problems. If I were the FBI, I'd want you real bad. Public enemy number one and all that. Lots of reward money. So I'm going to turn you in myself... lucky boy.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Rob.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Hi. You said we should finish talking.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Come in.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I think I need help.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Tell me why you think that.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I have compulsions to eat. I get hungry and I try to put it off for as long as I can but then, finally, I just... I get so hungry that I can't help myself, and...

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: You binge then purge? You eat too much and then cause yourself to vomit?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No. I just eat.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: But this makes you feel bad?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I guess it makes me feel like I'm not a good person.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Rob, there are so many different kinds of eating disorders. Men and women from every walk of life suffer from them but if there's one thing that they all have in common it's low self-esteem. And it's a shame because low self-esteem can be like a fun-house mirror. It reflects back a warped and ugly image of ourselves. What do you think Cindy Crawford would look like in a fun-house mirror?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Weird? Ugly?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: And how would the most handsome man in the world look? How would, say, Peter Jennings look in a fun-house mirror?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Ugly.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: And how do you look in this mirror? Do you think that looks like a bad person? An unworthy person? I'll tell you what I see. I see a nice smile... I see soulful brown eyes... I see good. Now, Rob, I want you to keep looking into this mirror until you see the same things that I do.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: There's a meeting that I'd like you to attend tonight. It's every Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Now, you can talk to me anytime you want but these people are the best. They can really help you. Overeaters Anonymous 817 Fairview Rd. Costa Mesa 7PM M - W - F)

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I have to go.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: You always hurry away.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I appreciate it. And I want you to understand that I really am trying to do right.

speaker: SYLVIA JASSY
line: Hey, Rob, you didn't tell me you had a friend in the FBI.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What?

speaker: SYLVIA JASSY
line: He's upstairs. I told him all about that strange man in the maroon car and he said he'd look in to it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Afternoon, Rob.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, may we speak with you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Derwood Spinks has disappeared.

speaker: MULDER
line: His car is gone along with some personal belongings.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My partner saw Spinks in your neighborhood yesterday morning. At that time, you told Agent Mulder that you hadn't seen Mr. Spinks. Is that correct?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I don't even know him that well. If he was going to leave town he wouldn't come tell me about it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who said he left town?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I don't know. Isn't that what you think happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no. Personally, I think he's dead. I can't speak for my partner but I think that whatever it was that killed Donald Pankow also got to Mr. Derwood Spinks.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What do you mean, "whatever it was"?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll let you in on a little secret. We've been able to keep it pretty quiet up until now but Donald Pankow's brain was missing from his skull. My partner was able to find something that was previously undetected. It was the tip of what can only be described as a tiny shark's tooth embedded deep in the bone. I think we're looking for some kind of genetic freak-- a carnivorous predator as yet unidentified. A monster, if you will.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: There's no such thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't you believe it. This thing definitely qualifies. It has a biological imperative to eat. I think it even ate that ground chuck you threw away.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah? Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because it can't kill with impunity and it knows it. It knows that the more it feeds on humans the closer it gets to getting caught but the hunger is always there. And it satisfies it any way it can.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I'm sorry, but this is like good cop, insane cop.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Why are you telling me all of this?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you know why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you, Mr. Roberts. We'll contact you if we have any further questions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Watch out for that monster.

speaker: WOMAN AT OA
line: Devil's food with the white sugar frosting. It is, like, deliver me from evil.

speaker: WOMAN AT OA
line: Come on in. Come on. So I baked three dozen of these for my daughter's school fund-raiser and them, lined up and calling to me. Well, you know, in the past, there'd have been a good chance I'd have gone through every single last one of them. But this night...

speaker: SYLVIA
line: Small world, huh?

speaker: WOMAN AT OA
line: ...I laid in bed thinking about these meetings...

speaker: SYLVIA
line: Is this your first time at a meeting?

speaker: ROB
line: Yeah.

speaker: WOMAN AT OA
line: ...I got one six-ounce plain yogurt and ate it.

speaker: WOMAN AT OA
line: Thank you. Does anybody else have anything they want to share?

speaker: SYLVIA
line: Do you feel up to introducing yourself? Everybody's really nice.

speaker: WOMAN AT OA
line: Anyone?

speaker: SYLVIA
line: Don't be scared; it helped me.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Uh, hi. My name is Robert Roberts. People call me Rob.

speaker: ALL
line: Hi, Rob.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I have an eating disorder. I'm definitely a meat-eater, not a vegetarian. I've always had these cravings my whole life and just... just recently, the last month or so they've just become too powerful to resist.

speaker: SYLVIA
line: Tell us about it.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I guess it's the taste I respond to the most-- salty and juicy. Kind of buttery. The texture of it inside of your mouth... You know, your teeth just sink into it like this juicy cloud, and it tastes so good you don't... You don't even want to swallow it. You just want to work it around your taste buds until your eyes roll right back into your head.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Anyway, it's a real problem.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Wait a minute. Your ex-husband did what?

speaker: SYLVIA
line: He said I was too fat to ride in his sports car-- that I'd just mess up the springs. So I sat on the hood and I bounced.

speaker: SYLVIA
line: And I didn't stop until the police showed up. They sided with me.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Hey, thank you, Sylvia.

speaker: SYLVIA
line: Good night, Rob.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Good night, Sylvia.

speaker: SYLVIA
line: I'll be right there.

speaker: MAN
line: What the hell is going on?!

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Oh, my God! Call the police!

speaker: WOMAN
line: Is everything okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Derwood Spinks. Alive and well. I'm confused, Rob. Was he helping you redecorate?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I lied to you before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Derwood was... was coming from my place the morning you saw him. He said if I spoke to you, he'd kill me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What didn't he want you to tell us?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Last Friday night he hung out while I was cleaning out the freezer. He told me to go home. He said he'd finish up. I didn't know why the hell he was being so nice to me, but... when I got home I realized I had the key to the dumpster. And when I drove back... I saw him cleaning up all this blood.

speaker: MULDER
line: You must have been very scared.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I was. But you know, I should have... told the truth from the start.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you recognize this guy?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's a private eye. Sylvia Jassy's ex-husband hired him to spy on her. But now this Steve Kiziak has gone missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was last seen parked outside your apartment. You didn't notice him?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No, I didn't notice anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe we should check with Sylvia again.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I don't think she's home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we'll track her down. Don't worry, Rob, it won't be long now.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Oh, my God. Rob, what happened?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: It's a long story. What do you want?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: I, uh, I was in the neighborhood and I thought I'd say hi.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Hi.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Rob, are you all right? Did you do this?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No. Derwood Spinks did this. You know, he's the one who... like I said, it's a long story.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Where are you going?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: To a friend's house. I have to leave, actually. As in now.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Are you sure you're all right? You're not feeling...?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yes, absolutely. I'm-I'm fine, you know?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: It's just that when you came to see me yesterday I sensed that there were things that you wanted to talk about but couldn't.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: That was yesterday.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Well, can we talk about them now?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Look, let me stop you right there, okay? You don't have to worry about me anymore. As of...... I quit.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Rob, I'm here as a friend.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Well, then consider me cured. I had a breakthrough last night.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Did you attend the OA. meeting?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: How did it go?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: It was a complete and utter waste of my time.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: I'm sorry you felt that way.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: So they're a bunch of fat people. So what? Maybe they've got what you would call a biological imperative to eat too much. Did you ever think of that? Did you? You know, maybe I've got a biological imperative, too. So why is that such a bad thing?! Like the world's going to end? That is biology. You can't fight biology. You can't.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Sounds like you're saying you're tired of feeling guilty.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Bingo. I am sick and tired of pretending that I'm something that I'm not.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: You killed that man, didn't you?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: What did you just say?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: That's why you feel so guilty, isn't it? Can you tell me why you did it?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Who have you been talking to?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: No one. I realized it after our last session.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: You spoke to the FBI, didn't you?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: I haven't spoken to anyone and I won't without your permission but I am here to ask you to turn yourself in. I want you to get the help that you need.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: You don't know what the hell you're talking about.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Yes, I do, Rob.

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: No, you don't! You said... you don't believe in monsters, right? How about... now?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: How about... now?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: Do you believe in monsters?

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: You poor man. What you must go through.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: Step away, Rob. Step away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Rinehart, step away from him.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Don't hurt him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Rob, we tracked Sylvia down on the way to the landfill. You just can't stop yourself, can you? Get on the floor. Rob, get on the floor.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Rob... Be that good person I know you mean to be.

speaker: DR. MINDY RINEHART
line: Why?

speaker: ROB ROBERTS
line: I can't be something I'm not.
